description: From French plantigrade, from Latin planta (“sole of the foot”) (from Proto-Indo-European *pléh₂-n̥t-eh₂, from Proto-Indo-European *pleh₂- (“flat”)) + gradus (“pace, step”) (from Proto-Indo-European *gʰredʰ- (“to go, to walk”)).

entries.meaning: (zoology) Of an animal: walking with the entire sole of the foot on the ground.
(zoology) A plantigrade animal; an animal that walks with the entire sole of the foot on the ground.
